title: Craniopharyngioma Epidemiology and Classification
short_description: Clinical overview of craniopharyngioma incidence rates, age distribution, and tumor subtypes.
long_description: This document provides epidemiological data on craniopharyngiomas, rare intracranial tumors that affect 0.5-2 people per million annually and comprise 1.2-4% of pediatric brain tumors. The content details the characteristic bimodal age distribution with peaks in children (0-14 years) and older adults (50-74 years), equal gender distribution, and the predominance of adamantinomatous subtype which accounts for 86-89% of all craniopharyngiomas. This information is essential for understanding the demographic patterns and clinical presentation of these uncommon but significant brain tumors.
